means: 诉说，申诉，控告[后面常跟从句]

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"抱怨，埋忽"之意。
means: complain ： 侧重因对处境不满、待遇不公或自己有痛苦等而向别人诉说、埋怨。
grumble ： 指因对处境、待遇不满或其他个人因素而愤愤不平地向他人诉苦或自言自语。
murmur ： 多指因不满某人或某事而背着人自言自语地发怨言。

sentence.Network_en: If you're not satisfied with the life you're living, don't just complain. Do something about it.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于现况的不满，不能只是抱怨，要有勇气作出改变。

sentence.Network_en: Faculty members complain that their students are unprepared to do college-level work.
sentence.Network_cn: 学院的老师们抱怨说他们的学生还很不适应大学的课业。

sentence.Network_en: He came to complain about the volume of the music.
sentence.Network_cn: 他过来抱怨音乐的音量太高了。

list.abs: 白面葫芦娃的博客 - lil82 - 网易博客 ... （export） 出口 1. Stop complaining! 别发牢骚！ 2. You make me sick! 你真让我恶心！.

C ... competitive price 有竞争力的价格，价廉 complainant 原告，控告者 complaint 申诉.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French complaindre, from medieval Latin complangere 'bewail', from com- (expressing intensive force) + plangere 'to lament'

entry.def: If you complain about a situation, you say that you are not satisfied with it.

example.ex: Miners have complained bitterly that the government did not fulfill their promises...
example.tran: 矿工们愤愤不平地抱怨说政府没有履行诺言。

example.ex: The American couple complained about the high cost of visiting Europe...
example.tran: 这对美国夫妇抱怨到欧洲旅行的花销太高。

entry.def: If you complain of pain or illness, you say that you are feeling pain or feeling ill.

means.word_mean: 1. express complaints, discontent, displeasure, or unhappiness;

sentences.sentence: "She has a lot to kick about"

means.word_mean: 2. make a formal accusation; bring a formal charge;

sentences.sentence: "The plaintiff's lawyer complained that he defendant had physically abused his client"

auth_sentence.content: I should have googled something like men women complain.
auth_sentence.res_content: I should have googled something like men women complain.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I should have googled something like men women complain.

auth_sentence.content: You're just here to complain. Go for it!
auth_sentence.res_content: You're just here to complain. Go for it!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You're just here to complain. Go for it!

auth_sentence.content: But she did continue to complain about her weight.
auth_sentence.res_content: But she did continue to complain about her weight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But she did continue to complain about her weight.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抱怨,诉苦,怨言,控告;疾病
stems_affixes.word_buile: com全部+plaint抱怨→对全部东西抱怨
plaint抱怨→n.悲叹,感叹,抱怨,诉苦

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抱怨, 悲叹, 控诉
stems_affixes.word_buile: com全部+plain=plaint抱怨→v.抱怨, 悲叹, 控诉

Sentence.sentence: However, many complain that their school libraries do not have enough up-to-date interesting books and magazines.
Students have been complaining more and more about stolen property.
Mr Jobs had a reputation as a control freak （怪人）, and his critics complained that the products and systems he designed were closed and inflexible, in the name of greater ease of use.
A mother who is always complaining about being overweight or old sends the message that women are supposed to be thin and young.
He tells the story of a patient, a first-time mother who complained that her young son was always clinging to her, wrapping himself around her legs wherever she went.

I made an effort to get my supervisor to transfer me to another department, but he urged me not to complain too loudly, because the administration is more likely to replace me than the X-ray equipment.

means.word_mean: 抱怨, 诉苦; 投诉

sentences.en: You have no reason to complain.
She often complains that he is dishonest.
I have to complain to the manager about it.
sentences.cn: 对这件事我不得不向经理申诉。

means.word_mean: 诉说，申诉；控告[后面常跟从句]

sentences.en: He complained to the police that the boys had stolen his apples.
sentences.cn: 他向警方控告那些男孩偷了他的苹果。

jushi.english: Their hands blistered, but no one complained.
jushi.chinese: 他们手起了泡,可是没有一个人有怨言。

jushi.english: You have no reason to complain.
